DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective trial determine 72-hour survival out-of-hospital cardiac arrest ( OHCA ) improve initial endotracheal intubation ( ETI ) initial laryngeal tube ( LT ) airway management strategy .
DOC.detailed_description: The primary objective trial determine 72-hour survival out-of-hospital cardiac arrest ( OHCA ) improve initial endotracheal intubation ( ETI ) initial laryngeal tube ( LT ) airway management strategy . The null hypothesis 72-hour survival similar primary Laryngeal Tube ( LT ) SGA primary ETI airway management strategy . Evaluated secondary outcome include return spontaneous circulation , survival hospital discharge , neurologically intact survival hospital discharge , airway management performance , clinical adverse event .
DOC.criteria: Outofhospital cardiac arrest ( OHCA ) Adult ( age â‰¥18 year per local interpretation ) Nontraumatic etiology Initiation ventilatory support ( e.d bagvalvemask device , nonrebreather ma , etc . ) Known pregnant woman Known prisoner Major facial trauma ( visible major deformity , copious oral bleeding , etc ) Major bleed exsanguination ( e.g. , major upper low GI bleed , visceral perforation , major uncontrolled bleed laceration injury ) Patient receive initial care nonPART participate EMS agency capable performing ETI , LT , advance airway management Patients ET tube , LT advance airway device insert prior participate EMS agency arrival ( e.g. , inserted healthcare facility personnel ) Patients preexist tracheostomy Obvious asphyxial cardiac arrest ( e.g. , choke , foreign body aspiration , angioedema , epiglottitis , trauma mouth face , etc . ) Patients leave ventricular assist device ( LVAD ) total artificial heart ( TAH ) Patients preexist write `` donotattemptresuscitation '' ( DNAR ) order Interfacility transport Patients `` enroll '' bracelet
DOC.keyword: non-traumatic Out Hospital Cardiac Arrest ( OOHCA )
